column5: You campaining for mayor or something?!  All we got was one question.  What is our favourite place to fish..  No intro, no pics, just an open ended question.  Show us some love first, we might give some back.  Lake O.

If you got kids, you can't beat the Orilia Perch Fest in the spring  . If you see a red Princecraft with a 50 Honda tiller and an OFC sticker on the stern, drop your anchor beside me  . Just don't tell anybody else
So let's say I bump into you on the lake, should I provide a resume and a biography before I ask you if you've caught anything? Think about it for a sec.
The lake isn't the internet.  Think about that.
Who do you think you are coming onto a fishing website and asking about where people like to fish?  The nerve.
Jesus, some of you guys have your panties on WAY TO TIGHT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   Relax ladies.
Anywhere from the boat.  This is one spot I frequent a lot
Thanks for giving up my spot cranksbait...  ten years of hard work to find that spot all for naught...  Might as well start selling my gear on Ebay...

ive grown fond of ponds there's 3 local ponds i know of that i fish all the time i fish weedbeds within them and catch bass like a beast. i cant really name any specific places just try rivers look for deeper holes you know stuff like that.
If you bumped into me on the lake and I didnt know you I would bald face lie to you in fact ive been known to not set the hook and let fish on the line get away because someone was watching.
ALL fishermen are LIER'S except you and me and I have my doubts about YOU  (this is a OLD saying my friend's father would ofter repeat)
definately the grand river
I"d have to say the only spots I'm divulging would be the Big Rideau and Lake Erie (Long Point inner bay). Both are great fishing spots though.
water mostly.............
Lake Ontario
TORONTO HARBOUR!!!!!
Funny, reminds me when I was in a coffeeshop in BC, the grass kind of coffeeshop. Some dude asks an old time 'where did you get that.' The oldtime replies: "from the ground."
Whatever you do... don't go with the geeky guy with glasses... he cant catch anything..  My favorite spot is near matachewan, and north of rvier valley....
photoz fave carp hole  (can you see the rabbit?)    my fave spot
Lake Titicaca
James bay
My Aquarium!
Everybody's in a good mood for a change.  Must have been out fishing a few times.
Canada
Daytona pier, Florida...Atlantic Ocean...
If you're gonna claim the Atlantic Norm, I've got dibs on the Gulf of Mexico!!!
The Kawarthas..
Any conservation area lake that doesn't allow gas motors.

drainage ditch in front of my house...put some goldfish in there this spring.  Next day I watched the neighbour catching them with a bucket to give his children...so I guess its my neighbour's favorite fishing spot too
TEMAGAMI

Pointe Au Baril Ontario(Georgian Bay), French River( Northeast of highway 69?), Findlay Lake New York, Chautaqua Lake New York, Presque Isle Pa. East Harbor(off Lake Erie, Ohio) Sandusky Bay (off Lake Erie, Ohio), Black River(north of Elyria Ohio, trib of Lake Erie), Berlin Lake(Ohio), Milton Lake(Ohio), Clear Fork Lake(Ohio), Ladue(Ohio),West Branch(Ohio), Alum Creek(Ohio) West Harbor(Off Lake Erie), various shoreline areas of Lake Erie between Cleveland and Sandusky Ohio, and a million or so other places I haven`t fished.

I found a really hot spot once, so I figured I should mark the location. Since I haven't a GPS or any other such devise at my disposal I just pulled out my trusty Sharpie pen and drew a big "X" on the starboard side of my boat. Funny thing is, I just can't find any more fish where that X is.

Hey i just started fishing a weekend ago and i just wanted to know where i can go to fish since i enjoyed it so much...i didn't know asking a simple question like this would be so difficult to answer. I thought the purpose of using this forum was to ask questions and help each other out. To those who answered it maturely, thank you!
Your lucky to have received as much info as you did Johnny Boy....Usually, newbies that come in and blatantly ask members for hot spots get blasted.    p.s. Lake Ontario

Everyone here is all for helping and answering questions, but you have to understand that many people have dedicated a lifetime to finding and learning their own secret spots, myself inlcluded.  Asking for these spots is considered untactful.  I put in years of research for every spot I fish.  You are naive to think that people are willing to provide this information.  It's akin to standing on Bay Street and asking every passerby what their salary is.

I didn't think he asked for your 'secret spots'...   What is the harm in telling him 'Yeah, I was up at lake X last week, caught some nice pickerel in about 4ft of water using a white twister tail'  Simple way of providing the guy with a little help without divulging your honey holes.  BTW, your secret spots are most likely alot of other people's secret spots
I think it was a valid question.
Right on Clive, just last week as a mater of factly. Pick a bay any bay. Pick a creek any creek. This week even seems better from what I've heard.
Bernie's cottage!!!!!   Otherwise, I find that Bay of Quinte provides as much entertainment this old body can handle! HH

Welcome to the board, my fav is Lake Simcoe. It's got pretty much every species, LM Bass, SM Bass, pike, musky (limited), walleye(limited), perch, whitefish, lakers, bowfin, carp, crappie.  Your experience on this board will help you determine who is a helpful fisher friend and who's a jackass. I think you may have uncovered a few already.Good luck with that one.  Cheers!
Good one Chris. Do they tug hard ???      Ditto. Lake Ontario is number one on my list. Georgian Bay has to be second, followed by Simcoe & the Kawarthas.

My fav's are the Westerly Kawartha's, but I would love to spend some more time on the Moon and French River Basin's.  It's a valid question, but can be interpreted in different fashion.  This is a fishing forum and not a ballroom dance floor, be prepared to get ribbed once in a while.  It's all good.  Welcome to the sport, best of luck.  reefrunner
I like to fish the West Arm and West Bay area of Nippissing, it's challenging to say the least... but I have seen some nice fish come out of there  ... one or 2 of them were even on my line!

The Grand River and it's tributaries are my favorite hang-outs.  All the species are there; largemouth and smallmouth, pike, walleye, brookies, bows and browns, panfish.  Really accessable too, especially once you throw on some waders.
What are your favorite fishing spots?
10-16 fow with a rock/ sand bottom.
Thick weeds
Dominion.  Although i haven't caught one but the trout looks to be great fighters.   seriously though... anywhere that i think a fish might swim :S
Weedbeds with a healthy bunch on cabbage or reeds. Rocky shoals  - open water or coming off or in proximity to islands. Guess it depends on what I'm fishing for.
the front of the boat
with no one else on the lake
the internet
ditto.  lol.  i love fishing the slop
....Bars
Sorry guys, i meant which lakes?
Simcoe.    I like the back,cause Terry miss,s the best spots.L M A O
lake 'x'
Lake Ontario
gotta be over the lilypads... swimming a grub for bass in the kawarthas
sorry brian, didn't mean to give away your secret honey hole.

This reminds me when I was a kid (17 or 18) and just started deer hunting.  I parked the truck and seen a guy dragging his deer the last few steps to his car. I went over to admire his nice buck and asked him "mister where did you get the deer"  he said "in the woods"........  I like Lake Erie for perch and walleye, Ontario for salmon and trout and just about any Ontario inland lake that I have been on.  Bob
Right on. LOL I like that one.
Noted and uploaded.  Very tactful!  Here's mine..
Little Vermilion, shallow water.
Salmon River, NY.  Going after killer kings, cohos, and steelies in full-combat fishing conditions.  There's no life like it!
I can't believe no ones hammered this guy!? I thought this was OFC, 8 posts and he wants to know our favourite lakes???   unbelievable!
LOL I thought the same thing... FLAME ON!
